docComment:
/**
 * SharePoint Framework support for dynamic data bindings.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * This package provides the necessary infrastructure classes and public APIs necessary to run dynamic data, and implement components that use it.
 *
 * @packagedocumentation
 */
name: @microsoft/sp-dynamic-data

members.docComment:
/**
 * Class that contains the Dynamic Data reference. This includes the source, property, and property path (if applicable) of Dynamic Data
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * The reference string is of the form `<sourceId>:<property>` or `<sourceId>:<property>:<propertyPath>`
 *
 * Examples of references are: `WebPart.<componentId>.<instanceId>:myComplexProperty:myArray[0].lastName`
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: DynamicDataReference
property
propertyPath
reference
sourceId

members.docComment:
/**
 * Describes the value and the structure of a property value. It contains sample value of the property and the metadata describing the structure of that value.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: IDynamicDataAnnotatedPropertyValue
metadata
sampleValue

members.docComment:
/**
 * Interface for components to implement in order to be dynamic data sources. This can be implemented as an object with state, or a set of loose functions that returns the data.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: IDynamicDataCallables

members.docComment:
/**
 * Returns list of allowed events on the dynamic data source.
 *
 * When this function returns a non-empty result, then source must define 'sendEvent' api.
 *
 * If this api is not defined or returns an empty array, then no consumer will be able to talk to this source.
 *
 * @beta
 */
members.name: allowedEvents

members.docComment:
/**
 * Given a property id, returns its annotated value. If the source doesn't supply the annotated value, then it falls back to whatever 'getPropertyValue' returns as the sample value and metadata would be undefined.
 *
 * @param propertyId - One of the property ids exposed from the dynamic data source.
 */
members.name: getAnnotatedPropertyValue
getPropertyDefinitions

members.docComment:
/**
 * Given a property id, returns the value of the property.
 *
 * @remarks
 *
 * It is assumed that when this function returns an array, it is homogeneous.
 */
members.name: getPropertyValue

members.docComment:
/**
 * If defined, enables the consumer to send data to the associated dynamic data source. Then source can act accordingly.
 *
 * Invoking this api throws an error when the passed in 'eventName' is not one of the allowed events on the source.
 *
 * @param eventName - A case-sensitive string representing the name of the event.
 *
 * @param data - Data to be sent to the dynamic data source.
 *
 * @beta
 */
members.name: sendEvent

members.docComment:
/**
 * Definition of an event which a dynamic data source accepts.
 *
 * It includes the name of the event and description to be seen and used by end users.
 *
 * @beta
 */
members.name: IDynamicDataEventDefinition
description
name

members.docComment:
/**
 * Definition of a property. It includes the id of the property to be used with the APIs, along with a user-friendly, localized title and description to be seen and used by end users.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: IDynamicDataPropertyDefinition
id

members.docComment:
/**
 * Metadata of a property
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: IDynamicDataPropertyMetadata
description
title

members.docComment:
/**
 * Metadata describing the sample value of the property.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: IDynamicDataPropertyValueMetadata
metadata
IDynamicDataPropertyValueMetadataCollection

members.docComment:
/**
 * Dynamic Data Sources provide Dynamic Data to consumers. They offer metadata to identify the data sources and API to get the data.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: IDynamicDataSource

members.docComment:
/**
 * Returns list of allowed events on the dynamic data source. When this api returns a non-empty result, then source must define 'sendData' api.
 *
 * If this api is not defined or returns an empty map, then no consumer will be able to talk to this source.
 *
 * @beta
 */
members.name: allowedEventsAsync

members.docComment:
/**
 * Given a property id, returns its annotated value. If the source doesn't supply the annotated value, then it falls back to whatever 'getPropertyValue' as the sample value and metadata would be undefined.
 *
 * @deprecated
 *
 * - This API is deprecated. Please use the asynchronous version `getAsyncAnnotatedPropertyValue`
 *
 * @param propertyId - One of the property ids exposed from the dynamic data source.
 */
members.name: getAnnotatedPropertyValue

members.docComment:
/**
 * Given a property id, returns its annotated value. If the source doesn't supply the annotated value, then it falls back to whatever 'getPropertyValue' as the sample value and metadata would be undefined.
 *
 * @param propertyId - Property id for which the value is requested.
 */
members.name: getAnnotatedPropertyValueAsync

members.docComment:
/**
 * Returns all the property definitions for dynamic data. This needs to be overriden by the implementation of the component.
 *
 * @deprecated
 *
 * - This API is deprecated. Please use the asynchronous version `getPropertyDefinitionsAsync`
 */
members.name: getPropertyDefinitions
getPropertyDefinitionsAsync

members.docComment:
/**
 * Given a property id, returns the value of the property. This needs to be overriden by the implementation of the component.
 *
 * @deprecated
 *
 * - This API is deprecated. Please use the asynchronous version `getAsyncPropertyValue`
 *
 * @param propertyId - Property id for which the value is requested.
 */
members.name: getPropertyValue

members.docComment:
/**
 * Given a property id, returns the value of the property. This needs to be overriden by the implementation of the component.
 *
 * @param propertyId - Property id for which the value is requested.
 */
members.name: getPropertyValueAsync
id
metadata

members.docComment:
/**
 * If defined, enables the consumer to send data to the associated dynamic data source. Then source can act accordingly.
 *
 * Invoking this api throws an error when the passed in 'eventName' is not one of the allowed events on the source.
 *
 * @param eventName - A case-sensitive string representing the name of the event.
 *
 * @param data - Data to be sent to the dynamic data source.
 *
 * @beta
 */
members.name: sendEvent

members.docComment:
/**
 * Metadata of the Dynamic Data Source. It allows consumers to easily distinguish Dynamic Data Sources.
 *
 * @public
 */
members.name: IDynamicDataSourceMetadata
alias
componentId
description
instanceId
title
